description: 'Musk Fictions' (5/6). The British author of 'The Lord of the Rings' is a source of inspiration that the billionaire openly claims for his 'civilizational survival' projects.

Leaders of Armenia and Azerbaijan shake hands and sign deal at White House peace summit
description: Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev and Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan, who called the agreement a 'significant milestone,' said the breakthrough was made possible by Trump. The signing of a deal between Armenia and Azerbaijan, both former Soviet republics, also strikes a geopolitical blow to their former imperial master, Russia.

headline: Agnès Levallois: 'The war in Gaza is political and has no military rationale'
description: In an opinion piece for Le Monde, the vice president of the Institute for Research and Studies on the Mediterranean and the Middle East, analyzes statements by Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, who has announced his intention to take full control of the Gaza Strip.

headline: Direct mayoral elections in Paris, Lyon, Marseille get green light from France's top court
description: The voting system in France's three largest cities will change in 2026, allowing voters to cast their ballots directly for central city councilors. The change could benefit right-wing mayoral hopeful Rachida Dati.

headline: Life with a disfigured face: 'You never get used to others' stares, you just live with it'
description: Whether due to an accident or illness, a major facial alteration can profoundly disrupt one's sense of identity. People who have been disfigured describe the painful processes of reclaiming their lives.

How Lake Chad became neglected by international aid
description: 'Lake Chad's Troubled Waters' (3/4). After a surge of solidarity in response to the attacks by Boko Haram, global attention has shifted away from the region. As NGOs have been weakened by the halt in US funding, the humanitarian situation remains dire.

headline: In France, suicide affects men three times more than women
description: With 13.4 deaths per 100,000 inhabitants, the suicide rate appears to have reached a 'floor' after several decades of decline. While the mental health of young people has drawn significant attention, it is older men who continue to be the most affected.

headline: Eighty years after Hiroshima and Nagasaki bombings, the fight for survivors' memories to live on
description: In Japan, the two cities have long promoted peace and nuclear disarmament, led by survivors of the 1945 nuclear bombings. As their voices fade, both cities are striving to carry their message forward.
